Description: Terracotta disk. Fishing or, more likely, loomweight. Hand-made disc with two holes pierced before firing. Pale yello-green marl fabric with fine white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Egyptian, pre Ptolemaic, style look weight. Unlikely to be fishing weight as holes are too fine.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (TF.10) (Phase 3)
